refnamediv.refname: Integrating Common Language Runtime Objects with Virtuoso

refsect1.title: Overview
refsect1.para: This tutorial demonstrates Web Services hosted on Virtuoso. The Web Service was created using MS Visual Studio.

refsect1.title: Prerequisites
refsect1.para: The following prerequisites ensure the usability of these tutorial demos on Windows

itemizedlist.listitem:
Windows
.NET Runtime and Frameworks .Net Runtime and Framework SDK (if you seek to write your own Objects for integration with Virtuoso) Virtuoso Universal Server for Windows with .NET CLR Hosting

refsect1.title: Tutorial Example
refsect1.para: Please follow the steps below to maximize the value of this tutorial:

orderedlist.listitem: Click on the "Set Initial State" link which registers the two C# classes within Virtuoso. Click on the "ho_s_12.sql" link to see the code behind this step.
Click on the "Run" links to execute the demos.

"ho_s_12.sql" performs the following steps:
Defines a Virtual Directory called "asmx_tutorial". Imported WSDL to define types needed for virtuoso soap client. Defines a procedure to return soap cal result using previously defined types.
The "asmx_tutorial.vsp" shows all end-points URLs defined from the Web Service.
